reviewText: Finally watched this movie last night,omg the memories of the Snake and Mongoose and the old drag strips,I was born in 1964 so I remember everything about when the hot wheel sets came out and there is so much more to the story than I imagined.Hot wheels are the most iconic toy made,Mattel was genius on marketing.turn on your surround sound and sit back and enjoy this instant classic. I'm proud to say I have a first reissue of the Snake and Mongoose drag race set that came out in the early 90's,still in the box and complete never been used,and yes the cars are still wrapped in bubble wrap,back then hot wheels were gaining popularity again and if you found these tracksets at a store usually the box was torn open and the cars were stolen out of the set.these sets are legendary with a dual loop drag strip with parachutes that pop out under the cars when crossing the finish.to this day I still have the first hot wheel car my dad gave me as a kid,a blue convertible pontiac firebird.
summary: if you were living in this era you will love this movie

reviewText: One great movie....Of two of the all time great drivers.And they even put SDH on it for the hard of hearing. And that is REMARKABLE. Most movies like this don't take the time to do that.Glad they did...If you are a true drag racing fan.. This is for you 100%...A must see...The only bad thing is......They left out a Ton of stuff..... This Movie should be about 3- 3 1/2 hrs long... To really get the complete story in...
summary: Great Movie....And REMARKABLE they even put SDH on it for the hard of hearing.

reviewText: Story of Don 'The Snake' Prudhomme and Tom McEwen as they navigate the world of pro drag racing in the 1960's and 1970's. Tom realizes that advertising is where the $ is so he and Don form a company together to drag race and promote themselves.  They get together with toy makers and promote themselves.  It goes well.But all good things must end both on the track and in their lives and that is covered in this tale as the guys helped create the movie. The extras includes a Behind the Scenes with interviews and additional footage that is very informative.

reviewText: This truly one of the best pictures about N.H.R.A. Championship Drag Racing. It's a true story and tells of how the two drivers not only fought for their wins, but also a look at their individual lives. They were the ones that opened the door corporate door for sponsorship in the N.H.R.A.
Title: N/A

reviewText: A bit corny at first.  Great biography for both.  Nice touch adding in actual racing videos.  A bit of a tear jerker near the end.  Makes you respect the two even more.  Best part, the end.  No criticism, simply great photos and short video clips of the two.  If you think the best days of drag racing are behind, these two guys reinforce that thought.  Racing today is to "PC".  If you've got money, you can race and dominate.  At the peak of their career, few drag racers had big bucks to race with.  It was almost completely done by the desire to win.
summary: Great story about two early drag racing legends.

reviewText: why is this "real"?  Because I am a casual observer not an NHRA fan, and after reading other reviews I think a straight forward review is lacking and this film deserves one. My only history is I had the Hot Wheels. For reference I will use Rush, another race film.This movie has lots of vintage footage, which I like- compare to the kind of bluish hue in Rush. I'll tell you what I thought- I absolutely loved it. What an enjoyable time spent watching it. The human drama here is different from Rush but no less compelling. I thought the casting was ideal; the acting was great all around; I enjoyed all the vintage footage, and I really liked getting to know the men behind the names, their personal stories and struggles. This IS NOT, let me be clear, a movie for race fans. This is just a great movie. If you are a race fan you will especially love it, but this movie stands as it is, on it's own as a story that is worth telling. This would be a great date night or family movie- movies like this are why we invented popcorn. I admit I didn't have high expectations going in- boy was I ever wrong. It is so refreshing to have a compelling movie like this that is such that you can just sit back and let it transport you into a great story; unlike Rush, this isn't really about losing or winning- when you see it you will realize it is about something more important in people. I cannot believe how much I enjoyed it. .

reviewText: "What you have in your office right here is the biggest draw in racing." In the 1970's the NHRA drag racing circuit was just starting to grow. The two biggest stars Don "The Snake" Proudhomme (Williams) and Tom "Mongoose" McEwen decide to join together and form a partnership. This partnership leads to a sponsorship with Hot Wheels as well as taking the sport to new heights. But like most things the rivalry on the track leads to tension off. I have stated before that I am not a big car racing fan, real life or movies. I wasn't a fan of Days of Thunder but I did think Rush was OK. This one is more along the lines of Rush. This one deals with the off the track aspect rather then the actual on track racing. The acting is OK but the thing that really helps the movie is the fact that it used actual race footage during the scenes, rather then the cheesy recreations most often used. Again though racing fans will really like this, but for people like me, I thought it was OK but nothing I'd watch again. Overall, better then I expected and the fact that real footage was used really made the movie that much better. I give this a B.
summary: Better then I expected and the fact that real footage was used really made the movie that much better.
Title: N/A
